THE GROUND PERSON RESPONSIBLE FOR CONTROLLING THE MOVEMENT DID NOT REALIZE THE MOVEWAS ON A RESTRICTED CLEARANCE TRACK UNTIL THE HIGH CUBE CAR STRUCK THE DOOR HEADER OF THE BUILDING EXTENSIVELY DAMAGING THE BRICK WORK AROUND THE DOOR EXTRANCE.  DURING FOLLOW UP INVESTIGATION THE GROUND PERSON WAS FOUND TO HAVE A MEDICAL CONDITION WHICH MOST LIKELY CONTRIBUTED TO HIS INATTENTION DURING THE SHOVING MOVE.  THE EMPLOYEE WAS REMOVED FROM THIS SAFETY CRITICAL POSITION.

2007273-d-09-25-07-ICE.Reporting Railroad Name: IOWA CHICAGO AND EASTERN RAILROAD CORPORATION
2007273-d-09-25-07-ICE.Maintenance Railroad Name: IOWA CHICAGO AND EASTERN RAILROAD CORPORATION
2007273-d-09-25-07-ICE.Narrative:
MMCMQ25 DERAILED 27 CARS ON THE MASON CITY SUBDIVISION. 

TRAIN HANDLING WAS RULED OUT, AS NO EXCEPTIONS TAKEN.  TRACK CONDITIONS WERE WITHIN FRA CLASS II STANDARDS AND THEREFORE WERE NOT CAUSAL.  RECOMMENDED IMPROVEMENTS WERE NOTED AND ARE IN PROGRESS INCLUDING INSTALLATION OF TIES, SURFACING, ELEVATION CORRECTION FOR CURVES, RAIL INSTALLATION ON CURVES, RAIL GRINDING PROGRAM, AND RAIL LUBRICATION.  WEDGE RISE ON ICE 50015 WAS ABOVE ACCEPTED STANDARDS AND IS THE PRIMARY REASON SPRINGS WERE DRIVEN SOLID (RESTRICTED SNUBBING).  IC&E CAR DEPARTMENT HAS INITIATED A PROGRAM TO INSPECT ALL CARS IN THIS SERIES AND INITIATE ANY WARRANTED TRUCK REBUILD PROGRAM THAT IS DEEMED APPROPRIATE.

THEREWERE NO INJURIES IN THIS DERAILMENT.  THE CREW WAS NOT DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED.

2007258-d-09-06-07-ICE.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
2007258-d-09-06-07-ICE.Narrative:
WHILE COMING DOWN THE MONONA HILL, ENGINEER FELT A BUMP AND THEN TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY, DERAILING 6 ENGINES AND 33 CARS.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.  THE CREW WAS NOT D/A TESTED.  THIS DERAILMENT OCCURRED ON 132# JOINTED ON LOW RAIL AND 136# CWR ON HIGH RAIL.

DYNAMIC WIDE GAGE DERAILMENT CAUSEDBY HIGH RAIL IN 8 DEGREE 30 MINUTE CURVE BEGINNING TO ROLL TO THE FIELD SIDE.  THIS WAS CAUSED BY ACOMBINATION OF LOSS OF WHEEL-SET STEERING CREATED BY EXTREMELY WORN AND FLATTENED LOW RAIL HEAD, ANDBY THE NEGATIVE CANT OF THE HIGH RAIL TO THE FIELD SIDE DUE TO DIFFERENTIAL TIE PLATE CUTTING, ALONG WITH COMPRESSIVE HIGH RAIL FORCES GENERATED BY THERMAL RAIL STRESSES.  28 DYNAMIC BRAKE AXLES RESULTED IN MODERATE BUFF LONGITUDINAL FORCES PUSHING THE RAIL AND CORRESPONDING MODERATE LATERAL WHEEL/RAIL FORCES.

0901071-d-09-01-07-PHL.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
0901071-d-09-01-07-PHL.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
0901071-d-09-01-07-PHL.Narrative: CREW WAS SHOVING THEIR TRAIN INTO THE TICTF SUPPORT YARD. THEY FILLED UP TRACKS 3 AND 4 AND INTENDEDON PUTTING 1 REMAINING CAR IN SY TRACK 1. THE CONDUCTOR LINED MOVEMENT FOR THE INTENDED TRACK HOWEVER RATHER THAN WALKING ALONGSIDE THE INTENDED TRACK, HE WAS WALKING ALONGSIDE AD TRACK 1. HE INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO SHOVE BACK INTO A CLEAR ALLEY HOWEVER HE WAS MISTAKENLY REFERRING TO AD 1 WHICHHE WAS WALKING ALONGSIDE AS OPPOSED TO THE INTENDED SY TRACK 1 WHICH WAS NOT A CLEAR ALLEY. THE TRAIN WENT DOWN THE INTENDED TRACK AND HIT A STANDING CUT OF CARS THE IMPACT OF WHICH CAUSED THE CAR THAT THEY WERE HANDLING TO DERAIL.
